title: Magnitude of acceleration during oval path

content.question: A figure of a dancer on a music box moves counterclockwise at constant speed around the path shown above. The path is such that the lengths of its segments, PQ, QR, RS, and SP, are equal. Arcs QR and SP are semicircles. Which of the following best represents the magnitude of the dancer's acceleration as a function of time t during one trip around the path, beginning at point PÂ ?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice A has a horizontal line plotted starting at the vertical axis and extending across the graph.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice B has a horizontal line plotted along the horizontal axis starting at the first t sub P until t sub Q. At t sub Q there is a vertical line to a point above the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line from t sub Q to t sub R. At t sub R there is a vertical line from the horizontal line to the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line along the axis from t sub R to t sub S. At t sub S there is a vertical line to the same value above the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line from t sub S to t sub P.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice C has a horizontal line plotted above the horizontal axis starting at the first t sub P until t sub Q. At t sub Q there is a vertical line to the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line along the axis from t sub Q to t sub R. At t sub R there is a vertical line from the horizontal axis up to the same value above the axis, then a horizontal line from t sub R to t sub S. At t sub S there is a vertical line from the plotted line to the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line along the axis from t sub S to t sub P.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice D has a horizontal line plotted along the horizontal axis starting at the first t sub P until t sub Q. At t sub Q there is a linearly increasing line to halfway between t sub Q and t sub R, then a linearly decreasing line back to the horizontal axis at t sub R. Then there is a horizontal line along the axis from t sub R to t sub S. At t sub S there is a linearly increasing line with the same slope as the last one to halfway between t sub S and t sub P, then a linearly decreasing line back to the horizontal axis at t sub P.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice E has a linearly increasing line starting at the first t sub P until t sub Q, then a linearly decreasing line from this point back to the horizontal axis at t sub R. It then has another linearly increasing line with the same slope from t sub R to t sub S, and then a linearly decreasing line from this point back to the horizontal axis at t sub P.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. The horizontal axes have evenly spaced tick marks with the first tick mark at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal axes. The tick marks are labeled t sub P, t sub Q, t sub R, t sub S, and t sub P.  Choice B has a horizontal line plotted along the horizontal axis starting at the first t sub P until t sub Q. At t sub Q there is a vertical line to a point above the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line from t sub Q to t sub R. At t sub R there is a vertical line from the horizontal line to the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line along the axis from t sub R to t sub S. At t sub S there is a vertical line to the same value above the horizontal axis, then a horizontal line from t sub S to t sub P.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
